citation.title: Congenital nephrogenic diabetes insipidus with a novel mutation in the aquaporin 2 gene.

comment.text: Forms a water-specific channel that provides the plasma membranes of renal collecting duct with high permeability to water, thereby permitting water to move in the direction of an osmotic gradient (PubMed:8140421, PubMed:7524315, PubMed:7510718, PubMed:15509592). Plays an essential role in renal water homeostasis (PubMed:8140421, PubMed:7524315, PubMed:15509592).

Shuttles from vesicles to the apical membrane (PubMed:15509592). Vasopressin-regulated phosphorylation is required for translocation to the apical cell membrane (PubMed:15509592). PLEKHA8/FAPP2 is required to transport AQP2 from the TGN to sites where AQP2 is phosphorylated (By similarity).
Expressed in collecting tubules in kidney medulla (at protein level) (PubMed:7510718). Detected in kidney (PubMed:7510718).
Aquaporins contain two tandem repeats each containing three membrane-spanning domains and a pore-forming loop with the signature motif Asn-Pro-Ala (NPA).
Ser-256 phosphorylation is necessary and sufficient for expression at the apical membrane. Endocytosis is not phosphorylation-dependent.

disease.name: Diabetes insipidus, nephrogenic, autosomal
disease.description: A disorder caused by the inability of the renal collecting ducts to absorb water in response to arginine vasopressin. Characterized by excessive water drinking (polydipsia), excessive urine excretion (polyuria), persistent hypotonic urine, and hypokalemia. Inheritance can be autosomal dominant or recessive.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

property.value: Group enriched (ductus deferens, kidney, seminal vesicle)
Vasopressin regulates renal water homeostasis via Aquaporins
Expressed in cortex of kidney and 130 other tissues

feature.description: In ANDI; loss of water channel activity; dbSNP:rs104894326.
In ANDI; loss of water channel activity; mutant protein does not fold properly; dbSNP:rs104894328.
In ANDI; mutant protein does not fold properly and is not functional; dbSNP:rs104894341.
In ANDI; loss of water channel activity; dbSNP:rs104894329.
In ANDI; results in the loss of arginine vasopressin-mediated phosphorylation at S-256.

In ANDI; exerts a dominant-negative effect on wild-type-AQP2 in that it interferes with its trafficking to the apical membrane; is a loss of function instead of a gain of function mutation on dominant nephrogenic diabetes insipidus.
In ANDI; retained in the Golgi compartment; dbSNP:rs104894332.

In ANDI; mutant protein folds properly and is functional but is retained in intracellular vesicles; able to assemble into tetramers with wild-type AQP2 that properly localize to the apical membrane; dbSNP:rs104894339.
No effect on sorting from the ER to the vesicles, redistribution to apical membrane, or endocytosis.
No effect on sorting from the ER to the vesicles, redistribution to apical membrane, or endocytosis.

No effect on sorting from the ER to the vesicles, redistribution to apical membrane, or endocytosis.
No effect on expression at the apical cell membrane.
